problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have 6 different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box 
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assigment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assigment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assigment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used to pack all items, minimized as objective
Assignment of each item to a box
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments : Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=100)]], Len(2, 2)]

decision_variables.description: x and y positions of each item within its assigned box

constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def fit_items_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=2, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=2, elem_type=ItemAssignment),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_X_Y_POSITIONS + 1):
        item : Item = items[i]
        pos : ItemAssignment = assignments[i]
        # Check if item fits within the box dimensions
        assert pos.x + item.width <= box_width
        assert pos.y + item.height <= box_height
        assert pos.x >= 0
        assert pos.y >= 0

fit_items_in_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

def match_assignments_to_boxes(
    box_assignments: DSList(length=2, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=100)),
    positions: DSList(length=2, elem_type=ItemAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS + 1):
        box_id : DSInt(lb=1, ub=100) = box_assignments[i]
        pos : ItemAssignment = positions[i]
        assert pos.box_id == box_id

match_assignments_to_boxes(item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=2, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=2, elem_type=ItemAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, N_X_Y_POSITIONS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_X_Y_POSITIONS + 1):
            pos1 : ItemAssignment = assignments[i]
            pos2 : ItemAssignment = assignments[j]
            item1 : Item = items[i]
            item2 : Item = items[j]
            # Check if boxes are the same
            if pos1.box_id == pos2.box_id:
                # Check for non-overlapping rectangles
                assert pos1.x >= pos2.x + item2.width or \
                       pos2.x >= pos1.x + item1.width or \
                       pos1.y >= pos2.y + item2.height or \
                       pos2.y >= pos1.y + item1.height

no_overlap(ITEMS, x_y_positions)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_box_consistency(
    items: DSList(length=2, elem_type=Item),
    box_assignments: DSList(length=2, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=100)),
    positions: DSList(length=2, elem_type=ItemAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item : Item = items[i]
        box_id : DSInt(lb=1, ub=100) = box_assignments[i]
        pos : ItemAssignment = positions[i]
        # Ensure the assigned box matches the position's box
        assert pos.box_id == box_id
        # Ensure item fits in the assigned box dimensions
        assert pos.x + item.width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert pos.y + item.height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        assert pos.x >= 0
        assert pos.y >= 0

ensure_item_box_consistency(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

def prevent_item_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=2, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=2, elem_type=ItemAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            pos1 : ItemAssignment = positions[i]
            pos2 : ItemAssignment = positions[j]
            item1 : Item = items[i]
            item2 : Item = items[j]
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if pos1.box_id == pos2.box_id:
                # Non-overlapping condition: rectangles do not overlap
                assert pos1.x >= pos2.x + item2.width or \
                       pos2.x >= pos1.x + item1.width or \
                       pos1.y >= pos2.y + item2.height or \
                       pos2.y >= pos1.y + item1.height

prevent_item_overlap(ITEMS, x_y_positions)

nr_used_boxes = objective
full_formulation:
Item = DSRecord({
    "width": DSInt(lb=1, ub=10),
    "height": DSInt(lb=1, ub=5)
})

ItemAssignment = DSRecord({
    "box_id": DSInt(lb=1, ub=100),
    "x": DSInt(lb=0, ub=1000),
    "y": DSInt(lb=0, ub=1000)
})



# --- Constants and Decision Variables ---
BOX_HEIGHT : int = 5
BOX_WIDTH : int = 10
ITEM1 : Item = {"width": 10, "height": 5}
ITEM2 : Item = {"width": 2, "height": 2}
ITEMS : DSList(length=2, elem_type=Item) = [ITEM1, ITEM2]
nr_used_boxes : DSInt(lb=1, ub=100)
item_box_assignments : DSList(length=2, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=100))
x_y_positions : DSList(length=2, elem_type=ItemAssignment)
N_ITEMS : int = 2
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 2
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 2


# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=2, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=100))) -> int:
    max_box_id = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS + 1):
        box_id = assignments[i]
        if box_id > max_box_id:
            max_box_id = box_id
    return max_box_id

calculated_objective_value = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
objective = calculated_objective_value

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def fit_items_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=2, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=2, elem_type=ItemAssignment),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_X_Y_POSITIONS + 1):
        item : Item = items[i]
        pos : ItemAssignment = assignments[i]
        # Check if item fits within the box dimensions
        assert pos.x + item.width <= box_width
        assert pos.y + item.height <= box_height
        assert pos.x >= 0
        assert pos.y >= 0

fit_items_in_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

def match_assignments_to_boxes(
    box_assignments: DSList(length=2, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=100)),
    positions: DSList(length=2, elem_type=ItemAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS + 1):
        box_id : DSInt(lb=1, ub=100) = box_assignments[i]
        pos : ItemAssignment = positions[i]
        assert pos.box_id == box_id

match_assignments_to_boxes(item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=2, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=2, elem_type=ItemAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, N_X_Y_POSITIONS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_X_Y_POSITIONS + 1):
            pos1 : ItemAssignment = assignments[i]
            pos2 : ItemAssignment = assignments[j]
            item1 : Item = items[i]
            item2 : Item = items[j]
            # Check if boxes are the same
            if pos1.box_id == pos2.box_id:
                # Check for non-overlapping rectangles
                assert pos1.x >= pos2.x + item2.width or \
                       pos2.x >= pos1.x + item1.width or \
                       pos1.y >= pos2.y + item2.height or \
                       pos2.y >= pos1.y + item1.height

no_overlap(ITEMS, x_y_positions)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_box_consistency(
    items: DSList(length=2, elem_type=Item),
    box_assignments: DSList(length=2, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=100)),
    positions: DSList(length=2, elem_type=ItemAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item : Item = items[i]
        box_id : DSInt(lb=1, ub=100) = box_assignments[i]
        pos : ItemAssignment = positions[i]
        # Ensure the assigned box matches the position's box
        assert pos.box_id == box_id
        # Ensure item fits in the assigned box dimensions
        assert pos.x + item.width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert pos.y + item.height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        assert pos.x >= 0
        assert pos.y >= 0

ensure_item_box_consistency(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

def prevent_item_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=2, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=2, elem_type=ItemAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            pos1 : ItemAssignment = positions[i]
            pos2 : ItemAssignment = positions[j]
            item1 : Item = items[i]
            item2 : Item = items[j]
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if pos1.box_id == pos2.box_id:
                # Non-overlapping condition: rectangles do not overlap
                assert pos1.x >= pos2.x + item2.width or \
                       pos2.x >= pos1.x + item1.width or \
                       pos1.y >= pos2.y + item2.height or \
                       pos2.y >= pos1.y + item1.height

prevent_item_overlap(ITEMS, x_y_positions)

nr_used_boxes = objective
